Package camzup.pfriendly

Class TextShape

java.lang.Object
camzup.pfriendly.TextShape
public abstract class TextShape extends Object
Converts AWT font glyphs to curves or meshes.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final char
    LINE_HEIGHT_SAMPLE_A
    One of two characters sampled from a font to establish an appropriate line height, 'l'.
    static final char
    LINE_HEIGHT_SAMPLE_B
    One of two characters sampled from a font to establish an appropriate line height, 'd'.
    static final char
    SPACE_WIDTH_SAMPLE
    Character used to establish the space of a width for a given font, '-'.

  • Method Details

    • glyphCurve

      public static CurveEntity2[] glyphCurve(PFont pfont, float scale, float detail, boolean separate, char... characters)
      Converts a list of characters to a an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses Bezier curves; when the detail is non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      pfont - the PFont
      scale - the curve scale
      detail - the level of detail
      characters - the characters
      separate - separate curve per char
      Returns:
      the array

    • glyphCurve

      public static CurveEntity2[] glyphCurve(PFont pfont, float scale, float detail, boolean separate, String str)
      Converts a string to a an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses Bezier curves; when the detail is non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      pfont - the PFont
      scale - the curve scale
      detail - the level of detail
      separate - separate curve per char
      str - the string
      Returns:
      the array

    • glyphCurve

      public static CurveEntity2[] glyphCurve(PGraphicsJava2D rndr, PFont pfont, float scale, float detail, boolean separate, char... characters)
      Converts a list of characters to a an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses Bezier curves; when the detail is non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      rndr - the renderer
      pfont - the PFont
      scale - the curve scale
      detail - the level of detail
      characters - the characters
      separate - separate curve per char
      Returns:
      the array

    • glyphCurve

      public static CurveEntity2[] glyphCurve(PGraphicsJava2D rndr, PFont pfont, float scale, float detail, boolean separate, String str)
      Converts a string to a an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses Bezier curves; when the detail is non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
      Parameters:
      rndr - the renderer
      pfont - the PFont
      scale - the curve scale
      detail - the level of detail
      separate - separate curve per char
      str - the string
      Returns:
      the array
